title: Victorian-ish Angular Slab Serif
content:
Hi Folks,  
Can anyone ID the slab used in "banker"?

Many thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023349im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fatcat_banker_type_3807.png)
author: malbright

comments.content:
Another Tuscan with [Detroit serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023349/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3A%22Detroit+serif%22) I can't indentify... Some alternatives: [Batak](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023349/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/batak-condensed-itc), [Fairplex](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023349/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/fairplex-ot), [Dickinson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023349/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/dickinson.php), [Vanilla Whale](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023349/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/vanilla-whale) (probably the closest, needs to be squooshed and /R leg redrawn (from /P?))  
Your best chance is probably to ask directly the designer. BTW, what's your sample origin?

Hi Ryuk!  
Thanks for the response! I got this from the site of one of my favorite designers, William Staehle.

Maybe I'll follow up with Will...just hate to bother him!

Thanks again!
Would really like to know too so if he tends to answer, I'd appreciate you drop me the answer here! Thanks in advance, Michael.
